data.title: Evergreen Park and Recreation, CO
data.meta_description:
EPRD Summer Concert Series 2023.
Wednesdays on June 28, July 12, July 26 and August 9.
Concerts alternate between Evergreen Lake House & Buchanan Park Field.
data.text:
2024 Concert times are on the following Wednesdays during the summer:

June 19 @ Evergreen Lake

June 26 @ Evergreen Lake

July 10 @ Buchanan Park Field

July 24 @ Evergreen Lake

August 7 @ Buchanan Park Field

Summer Concert Lineup:

June 19 - Evergreen Lake

Headliner - Don Chicharrón

Don Chicharrón plays Chicha, the sonic result of mixing ‘60s psychedelia, Andean traditional folk melodies, and Afro-Cuban cumbia rhythms. Formed by Peruvian-American, Aldo Pantoja, Don Chicharrón invites audiences to get tangled up in a canopy of trippy guitarwork, mesmerizing synth-play and shout celebratory chants.

June 26 – Evergreen Lake

Headliner - Midday Sons

Cort Langworthy - Vox, Guitar

Lopey Wedel - Bass, Harmony Vox

Dean Dalvit - Mandolin, Lead Guitar, Vox

Bob Strausser - Lead Guitar, Vox

Douglas Stormont - Thunder

Americana, Alt-Country, New Grass, and Rock-n-roll

The Midday Sons are a Colorado-based band that plays original Colorado music as well as covers if that's the jam. Usually a mix of the two that favors the original music. Covers can be anything and everything, but we will be sure to make them our own and bring a little alt-country vibe to whatever we do. Johnny Cash, Grateful Dead, Turnpike Troubadours, The Band, Ryan Adams, Lucero, The Stones, Uncle Tupelo, Wilco, Willie & Waylon just to name a few. We have played hundreds of gigs spanning the foothills as well as Denver, the Front Range and SXSW a few years back.

Opener - Public Picasso

Public Picasso, a band emerging from the mountains above Denver, Colorado has an eclectic sound pulling inspiration across four decades of soundscapes. Blending catchy indie pop lyrics with surf rock inspired anthems, Public Picasso evokes comparison anywhere from Peach Pit, to Nirvana, to The Velvet Underground.

July 10 – Buchanan Field

Headliner - Drew Dvorchak Band

Drew Dvorchak - Guitar & Vocals

Steven Huntley - Guitar & Vocals

Kalel Vigil - Bass & Vocals

Mike Dooley – Drums

Blues, Rock

The Drew Dvorchak Band is blues rock clashing with psychedelic funk while holding true to some of the most traditional folk styles. Their musical diversity stands out as the members of this band have backgrounds in blues, jazz, bluegrass, heavy metal, americana folk, funk & jam. Their grooves & fast paced jams are sure to get you on your feet and dancing!

Opener: Porch Moment

Porch Moment is a folk/singer-songwriter group, similar to the styles of Watchouse, and Gillian Welch and David Rawlings. Their individual songwriting and musical styles blend together to create beautiful harmonies, sure to take you on a journey to a place and time where you feel warm and peaceful- much like a moment on your own porch. Mark and Danielle reside in Evergreen, Colorado and you can find them playing music all along the foothills and beyond!

July 24 – Evergreen Lake

Headliner – The Tyler Philips Show

Tyler Phillips – Guitar & Vocals

Mason Hall – Drums & Vocals

Lowen Hall – Bass

Blues, Americana, and Mountain Rock

Tyler Phillips is a Colorado multi-instrumentalist, poet, songwriter, and producer. Tyler currently leads The Tyler Phillips Show and draws inspiration from The Band, Gary Clark Jr, Jimi Hendrix, and Leonard Cohen to engage audiences with high-energy, poetic performances that often explode into a fusion of high country blues, Americana, and jam-band-inspired extensions of original music and covers. On January 13, 2024, The Tyler Phillips Show debuted at Snowpack Underground in Conifer, CO and rocked the venue's first ever sold out concert with the Hall Brothers and Andrew Breimayer on guitar. The Show is currently in the studio recording material for their debut album, Greetings from Jackalope City, USA.

Opener #1: Alaithia Rooke

Opener #2: Kailani & Paris

August 7 – Buchanan Field

Headliner - Living Room Band

Joel Fisher – Bass/Vocals

Josh Wunsch – Drums

Peter Mitchell – Guitar/Vocals

Dave Recker – Guitar/Vocals

Rob Quinn – Percussion

Scott Cook – Keyboards

Rock, Jazz, Blues, Country, Latin, and Funk

The Living Room Band was created in 2020 as a platform for the members to push and expand their sonic horizons and test their musical mettle, with a focus on instrumental improvisation. Since then, the LRB has honed their skills to become a six-headed hydra all its own, crafting lyrical and instrumental tunes that intertwine threads of rock, jazz, blues, country, Latin, and funk, as well as performing a variety of fun and familiar covers in a set that is guaranteed to get you moving.
